Title: HOLLAND CASINO
Article: The GUESS n' WIN kioske was designed to attract casino clients to participate in the Highlights-campaign's guess-the-number game. As part of a fancy molded installation box, it was topped with a giant champagne glass, filled with pearls, to guess the total number. Designed and built by me in Flash, with WebServices secure backend and card-reader functionality.

Title: VODAFONE SCAN&WIN
Article: A retail below-the-line strategy for attracting consumers to participate in promotions and offers, and to give them a central mobile application to manage their information, and current events.

Title: TOYOTA FINDYOURMATCH
Article: This site required enterprise-level deployment demanding complete dynamic data from multiple sources, robust tracking, deep-linking, and high fidelity images in a 3D environment

Title: THE SECRET WORLD
Article: A facebook-data driven game-site. I was brought in with a team of top-shelf developers to produce this site in a very short amount of time using a PureMVC architecture.

Title: TOYOTA PRIUS HSD
Article: Created to introduce the Prius, and a whole new kind of car, our goal was to create a surreal city of blue sky and information about the new Prius. Using parallax and filtered 3D cell-shaded objects, this site was a success and helped to start the green movement.

Title: DODGE SRT
Article: Using a cutting-edge driving-simulator from Big Block LA that creates CGI-rendered sequences with live physics, as well as the Flame-editing of Chris Nolert, we created a motion-graphics heavy introduction that leads into an SRT-centric website.
